38688991.review:
We all have one of those games that we turn to to help us unwind and relax after a stressful day. 

In my case, it's not Glass Masquerade, but gods damn, if it ain't beautiful as hell. The music is lovely, and the puzzles are fairly challenging at times, all while providing some gorgeous stained glass designs as a form of reward for completing them.

There are, sadly, a couple of gripes, but they're pretty small ones.

The first is the issue with empty spaces not being the size of the pieces you'll be handling. More often than not, you'll be spending extra time trying to figure out where a shard will go, and wind up glancing over the exact spot time and time again, simply because the space is much smaller than the actual piece. 

The second gripe is that some puzzles have outer pieces, but the frames don't immediately tell you this. This means that you may spend several minutes trying to find a space for one shard, only to realize close to the end that it doesn't even go in the main design.

Really, it's not a bad game at all, and this is coing from someone who isn't a huge fan of puzzle games. 

Again: Great music and visuals, decently challenging puzzles, and the ability to track your times with each puzzle for constant improvement, but is slightly hampered by size issues, as well as unclear areas where a part needs to be.

38682741.review:
Glass Masquerade is a beautiful game featuring 25 jigsaw puzzles that can be solved within 2-20 minutes each depending on the puzzle's difficulty and your own skill. By default the game will help you with a couple of edge pieces at the start, but you can disable it if you want to add another layer of difficulty.

The puzzles consist of 10-100+ pieces which are turned upside down until you click on them. This might seem a little bit annoying, but you really have to go by the shapes to solve these puzzles. Each puzzle piece will have a different color and a golden border that will only disappear after it has been successfully placed. This will make the later puzzles difficult, but luckily they also all have weird shapes that could only connect with one other piece.

It is a very relaxing game that offers a beautiful soundtrack. You can just jump right into the game during the day and solve one puzzle if you need a little break or you can play through the game in one session without it becoming tedious because the puzzles distinguish themselves pretty nicely. You won't feel like doing the same puzzle twice in a row.

One negative thing in my opinion is that you can't zoom out of the world map. It's not that necessary, but scrolling from one end of the map to the other is incredibly frustrating and you're forced to do so since the path to unlock new puzzles goes in both directions. A couple of people are also complaining about the regular price (5 bucks for 3-4 hours), but I do think the quality justifies it.

Overall I recommend Glass Masquerade to everybody who's looking for an unique and beautiful jigsaw puzzle experience. And if you're new to puzzles and want to try one out, this is certainly the type of game to start with.

38669105.review:
One of the most beautiful casual puzzle games out there, and I play a lot of them. The music is nice and there never feels to be a rush to complete puzzles while you're doing them, even though the game will save your best times. In this way, Glass Masquerade is a very peaceful experience and ideal for people who want to relax after a stressful or busy day.

I also love the theme of each puzzle. Each one symbolizes a different country, and showcases its culture or history. This leads to a game that ties together well and gives the player motivation to keep playing and collect all of the artwork. That is something which I don't think is easy to do with a jigsaw game. With other games I'll usually just do one or two and then come back later when I want to kill time, but this game truly drives me to keep playing... THAT SAID...

As others have pointed out, there is a lack of content. For the price of 2-5 bucks (currently it's on sale for $1.75) I don't see it as a big deal, to me it's like paying for a movie to get a few hrs of entertainment... but realize that unless you enjoy redoing puzzles you will probably only get 3 to 5 hours of enjoyment out of this.

優美的音樂、華麗的畫面、匠心獨具的機制，以上三點就是成就一部完美益智遊戲的要素。

Glass Masquerade在機制方面其實就是純粹的拼圖，不過在移動方式、拼圖不選取時任意擺放等方面做得不錯，讓遊戲玩起來十分流暢。

美術方面可以說是讓本作與眾不同的地方，全部關卡皆為世界上各具特色的國家，而你所拼出的拼圖就是在彩繪玻璃中加以融入各國特色的畫面，這讓遊戲在過程中看起來像是在創作一幅美麗的畫作。

If you answered No to any of these questions, than sadly I can not recommend this game to you.

If you said Yes to all of these questions, well then go buy it! It's on sale (At the time I posted this review)!

8/10

Pretty stained glass pictures, pleasant music, and a pretty good system/mechanics for playing the puzzles.  I'm not great at these sorts of puzzles, but I found this game pretty good for a pleasant, rather than frustrating, challenge.

Replayability is limited.  You've got the set puzzles.  You can replay them at any time, and try for a quicker time.  But coming back every few weeks or months or something to try again seems worth it.

There are some downsides.  Pieces often don't seem quite to scale for where they fit, so that takes a bit of getting used to.  Stained glass means not the most clear pictures, so that makes it harder to put them together based on what's on the pieces.  You only see the pieces as a silhouette, which only show the image and align to the correct angle for placement once picked up.  But as you get used to it, none of those are all that frustrating.

This isn't the easiest review to write, which is odd because this is a _very_ simple game.  In fact I felt half-mislead by the presentation, which seemed closer to Pandora's Box or The Fool's Errand than an elabourate jigsaw puzzle game.

Glass is an attractive game.  It sounds good, it plays well for what it is, and the presentation is rather lovely.  It is very light weight, not overly complex--put pieces together, make a picture, move on with your day.

And that I suppose is why I don't recommend it.  There is no depth; a Level 5 puzzle simply has more and smaller pieces.  (A question: why use a 5-point difficult system when no puzzle goes below 3?)  While tha'ts not shocking in what is a jig saw puzzle game, it also only has 23 puzzles that all unlock rather quickly.  No randomization, no variations, no difficulty levels.  Once you've done all the puzzles, the game is over, something that takes about 4 hours.

Hardcore puzzle fans won't enjoy it, casual puzzle fans won't find enough substance.   A shame.

36528892.review:
可能是steam上最值得尝试的拼图游戏。同时也是steam上最棒的一款成就游戏。

游戏以法国的Art deco作为起点，精致华丽的美术表现形式让玩家欲罢不能。在极高质量的谜题图案下，游戏并没有像大部分传统拼图游戏一样设置一个对照图片，而是需要玩家充分用自己的耐心和智慧去解决这个问题。图案的谜题和对应国家相关，且通常具有对称性，知晓这两点能让玩家在拼接过程中事半功倍。游戏体验像是小心翼翼对待文艺工作品的修复人员，在完成拼图解开谜题时，收获的不仅仅是单纯拼图带来的混乱重归有序的欣喜，同时也收获了一些小知识，而最让人愉悦的是，得到了一个可供装裱的艺术品。

这款游戏共有二十七个成就，其中二十五个是国旗成就，可以拿来装饰自己的资料页面。不过，尽管它在画面上表现出无与伦比的优势，但是其还是带有些缺陷。比如说谜题的设计，有的时候国家与谜底的联系让人感觉颇为牵强。以下是我个人整理的联系列表（省略了中国与龙，按字母先后顺序排列）：

[b][h1]国家与谜底的联系[/h1][/b]
Argentina - Incas （印加帝国，文明玩家应该不会陌生，不过印加的实际军事和政治中心都位于今天的秘鲁而非阿根廷。印加帝国强盛时期几乎涵盖了整个南美洲大陆）

Brazil - Carnival（巴西狂欢节，世界最大的狂欢节）

Britain - Sherlock（大名鼎鼎的夏洛克.福尔摩斯，柯南.道尔的代表作中的主人公。）

Canada - Cranes（美洲鹤，私以为更适合用枫叶来代表。美洲鹤现时唯一的位点是在加拿大艾伯答省的野牛国家公园（Wood Buffalo National Park）之内。）

Egypt - Scarabeus（圣甲虫，古埃及的象征符号，经常会被用来放在木乃伊的棺椁中，据说有保护遗体的作用。圣甲虫同时也是古埃及神话中Khepri的象征。）

France - Art deco（装饰风艺术，名字来源于巴黎举行的“现代工业和装饰艺术博览会”。不过这种艺术风格直到1960年左右才开始真正流行起来。游戏的艺术主要表现方式便是Art deco。）

Germany - Knight （指的是条顿骑士团，大名鼎鼎的条顿骑士团，又称德意志骑士团，与圣殿骑士团、医院骑士团一起并称为三大骑士团。）

Greece - Minotaur（大名鼎鼎的弥诺陶洛斯，希腊神话中忒休斯在代达罗斯为这个牛头人设计的迷宫中没有迷路而最终将其击杀。此处的代达罗斯即DOTA2中的“大炮”的新名称中出现的人名，而这个迷宫在Fate中被设计成为了某个Berserker的宝具。）

Greenland - Haski（哈士奇，原名西伯利亚雪橇犬，在西伯利亚东北部、格陵兰南部生活。）

Iceland - Harp（这个联系有些不明所以，有清楚的朋友还望不吝赐教。最早的竖琴来自于苏美尔（Sumer）文明，而让竖琴有机会和其他乐器在古典乐中一争高下则是要感谢巴洛克时期对于竖琴乐器本身的改进。亨德尔的《F大调竖琴协奏曲》（Op4 No.5）正是当时的杰出音乐作品。其后包括莫扎特、拉威尔等古典音乐家都曾为竖琴写过协奏曲。）

India - Ganesha（伽内什，印度神话中有名的象神。游戏拼图采用的是其最经典的雕绘形象，注意到，它有一支象牙是断的。）

Indonesia - Butterfly（许多珍贵的蝴蝶分布在东南亚地区。）

Iran - Persepolis（波斯波利斯，波斯帝国的都城，曾经遭到亚历山大焚毁。文明系列玩家不会对此感到陌生。）

Italy - Masquerade （化妆舞会，游戏拼图中的假面指的正是威尼斯狂欢节中有名的面具。不过威尼斯狂欢节起源在12世纪左右，而当时威尼斯已经脱离了东罗马帝国获得自治权许久，成为了威尼斯共和国。）

Japan - Geisha（艺伎，日本特有的女性表演艺术工作者。这段摘自维基百科的介绍不得不让人浮想联翩...说到日本，私以为武士或者是浮世绘更具代表性。）

Madagascar - Harvest（马达加斯加的农业占比非常高，经济极度不发达。颇为尴尬的是，马达加斯加却经常会与“饥饿”等新闻挂钩。）

35405997.review:
通关撒花：玻璃假面舞会，一款拼图游戏，25个国家的风情与文化在华美的玻璃碎片中逐渐呈现出来，宛如艺术品一般，让玩家在休闲娱乐的同时又享受了一场视觉盛宴。音乐十分悦耳，难度又适中，实在是一款不可多得的佳作。

通关以后有种意犹未尽的感觉，不知制作组是否还会更新其他的国家拼图，或是开放创意工坊，让玩家能够享受到更多的游戏乐趣。全成就也很简单，只要拼完全部的国家就可以获得全成就。

拼图爱好者不可错过的一款游戏，而菲菲这个原本对拼图游戏不甚感冒的人也沉迷于摆弄那些精致的拼图碎片，更是在完成一幅幅作品之后有种奇妙的成就感，因此特别推荐给大家。

35364230.review:
玻璃假面舞会——一场华丽，优美，而不失残念的盛大舞会
优点：
1.丰富的文化背景
对于这个游戏，只有25个关卡，但是这25个关卡都包含一个国家的文化，换句话说，如果了解拼图的文化背景，就能
很快的解出结果，最简单的例子，是英国的福尔摩斯，墨西哥的玛雅文化，伊朗的拜火教，中国的龙等，而相对的，通过每个关卡你能学到不同国家不同的文化特色。
2.难度适中的解密
对于童年玩GB长大的我来说，金银里面的未知图腾迷宫里面的拼图让我有了很多的乐趣，而去年玩的塔洛斯法则，每一个世界的拼图也让我大费周章，而这个游戏呢，每一块拼图都是决定好方向的，上手度很高，但是相对的，每一块都是不规则的,这给我们这些玩惯了规则拼图的我们，增加了可以接受的难度。
3.优秀的拼图和bgm
每个关卡的拼图，都是一副艺术作品，唯美的玻璃画作让人叹为观止，配合每个大洲所特有的BGM，让人心旷神怡！（如果能加入一个展览功能就更好了）
缺点：
1.较少的关卡
这点是优点1的相对面，也是这个游戏的主要缺点，由于这个游戏只有25个关卡，所以就流程就很短。大概5个小时的流程就结束了，这对于解密爱好者来说，是一个比较遗憾的事情，不能尽情体会解密的乐趣就这么结束了，而且由于每个关卡都是很优秀的作品，所以想要加入创意工坊也十分困难。
2.不可自定义难度
这是优点2的相对面，如果能自定义难度，难度1来刷成就，欣赏文化，难度5来烧脑，那就真的很不错了.不过说真的，拼图大小不一致有时候是很蛋疼的。

总的来说，对于玻璃假面舞会这个游戏，我认为是值得21的，尤其是优美的拼图，值得你一次又一次的去拼。但是对于脑残级解谜爱好者，对高难度解密感到痴迷的人，这个游戏可能是有点残念的。
个人评分：3.5/5

34622956.review:
Beautiful puzzles, beautiful music, beautiful interface.

I often find myself looking at jigsaw-style puzzle games in the Steam store, and I always end up passing on them for one reason or another.

I don't remember when I first saw Glass Masquerade, but I couldn't recall the premise when I saw it again on my wishlist. I visited the store page, took a look, and immediately bought it and played through the whole thing essentially in a sitting. It's a series of 25 puzzles of varying complexity, unlocked 1 or 2 at a time through branching paths.

Part of the game control disappointed me at first: Although yet-unused pieces freely rotate while they rest in the selection area, they automatically snap into the correct orientation as soon as they are dragged into the puzzle board area. I was expecting the pieces to require rotation, with either 4 or 8 possible orientations, but no flipping backwards. It's also a little strange to me that yet-unused pieces sitting in the selection pool are blacked out in silhouette. I guess being able to see the colors might be too much of a giveaway, even though the stained-glass aesthetic means color isn't always a good hint.

Another complaint I have is that sometimes the intended location of a given piece seems impossible or is easy to miss. Pieces held by the player are slightly larger than the space they will occupy on the board (not sure if this was meant to imply perspective relative to the puzzle board), and pieces on the board have shiny lines bordering them. If you need to place a piece with a narrow branch sticking out of it, you might not be able to see where it belongs because the "branch" portion may appear to be covered up by the overlapping borders of other pieces. I'm not sure if this is a resolution issue or what.

Even with those minor gripes in mind, I enjoyed the game and I wish there was more. I guess maybe after some time passes I can replay it as if it was new.

Haski / 10

34576847.review:
Wonderful, casual jigsaw puzzle game, I highly recommend it for anyone who loves doing jigsaws.

Not going to do the usual ratings scale. No point. It's a 10, for me at least. Your Mileage May Vary, depending on how you feel about jigsaw puzzle games. This one is the best one I have seen. Ever.

The art is stunning for fans of stained glass, or those who appreciate fine arts.  

The music is quite relaxing, appropriate and soothing. Very nice audio here.

Runs smooth as melted butter, on an old toaster.

Puzzles are not too difficult, but not too easy either, due to the blind piece style used. You can add a touch more challenge by turning off the first piece highlighting that lets you see and snap the first pieces to predetermined dots on the puzzleboard. I did this, and played slowly, 5.7 hours for my first playthrough.

You cannot see unplaced pieces until you pick them up, which I like. The game does auto-rotate pieces to their correct orientations for placement, which some may find helpful. I would have like having this able to be turned off and manual piece orientation needed, but no gamebreaker. It was challenging enough to find the correct blank shapes to choose to flip over and fit into the open spaces. Kept my brain active while I played, and kept me engaged. The piece count per puzzle is not high, but the random shapes of the pieces along the stained glass lead-lines kept it from being too simple. Might be a bit frustrating for young kids or folks with ADHD or OCD- for real. I can see this game being either good therapy for either condition, or a potential problem for those who suffer from either.  Could go either way. I have a bit of OCD myself, and found it good therapy, for calming down and remembering not to stress out over things. 

I bought this on sale, and it was more than worth the sale price of $2.99 USD. Full price of $4.99 USD is worth it, and I would have been just as happy if I had paid that amount. 

Replayability? For me, yes. I feel that it has that. No time penalties, but it does record your time to complete each puzzle. And I want to go back and beat my first times. Even without the time recordingds, I know I will play this again just for the beautiful art and music, and for the stress relief and relaxation it provided.

A very nice, quality offering from an apparent first time Indie studio. I look forward to seeing what they offer next.

33984088.review:
[b]Glass Masquerade [/b](Puzzle)

Some of the options included are Resolution, Full-screen, Custom Cursor, Sensitivity, Hints on/off, and separate sliders for sounds and music.

Having the [b]Hints[/b] on will give you help with placement of some edge pieces, giving you a good starting place, since we don't know what any of the clocks look like until we finish.  The way the hints work is that a few select pieces will glow red, and have a gold ring on them that you can match up on the clock face.  FYI, I played with hints ON.

There are 27 countries, 27 puzzles, and... wait for it... 27 Steam achievements.

As you can imagine with stained glass, these are not simple puzzles with predictable shapes and patterns.  Even when you have an idea what the image will include, you'll likely still find these to be a challenge.  For example, I was pretty sure I knew what the USA puzzle would portray, and it still took me 15.5 minutes to complete.  I somehow managed to finish one puzzle in less than two minutes, but there was also one that took me 21 minutes, so difficulty varies.  

There are two things the devs did to [b]increase difficulty[/b].  First, the unplaced puzzle pieces slowly rotate, making shapes harder to track.  In addition, pieces sometimes look too big for where you're going to place them, but that is because they [i]overlap[/i] just a smidge!  [b]On the plus side[/b], when you pick up a piece, it automatically swivels to the proper orientation for placement.  The game would have been well-nigh impossible without this feature, so I'm glad they added it... Although some might view this as a missed opportunity to add a nightmare difficulty mode ;)

The music is very calm and relaxing, and did not seem to be linked to countries (or at least I didn't notice it changing when I changed countries.)

Once you have finished the game, you can go back in, replay any puzzle, and compete with yourself or your household to see who can finish the fastest (it will show you your time when you place the last piece.)

This was a very enjoyable game, with gorgeous graphics, intricate patterns, and relaxing gameplay and music.  I would have liked to see more puzzles (or bigger ones), but I still highly recommend this one to any puzzle-lover.

33619915.review:
This is a pretty good jigsaw game. It has a number of oddities which will either frustrate you or add some difficulty, depending on your point of view.

First, you can't see what the pieces actually look like until you drag them around. Second, you can't fit pieces together unless you're actually placing them on the grid, so (because the pieces are hidden unless you're dragging them around), the puzzles sometimes take on a bit of a memory-game aspect. "OK, this piece is one of the bird's wings, I know I saw another one which was the mirror image of that somewhere, now where was it ..." Third, the outlines of the pieces dont always match the spaces they fit into in the puzzle very well.

I felt all of these things added difficulty, and that this was good because the puzzles are not especially hard.

One quirk of the game is that the "dials" that display the pieces don't work the way you might expect them to. Although it looks like there's an inner dial and an outer dial, the sets of pieces you're rotating through on the left and the right sides of the dial aren't the same. That is, there are actually four sets of pieces to scroll through, it's just that often two of them scroll at the same time.

The game is pretty short - I took my time, doing a couple of puzzles a night in a leisurely way, and it lasted me about four hours. If I'd done it all in a single binge it probably would have taken me two.

33612071.review:
首先要谢谢fenx的礼物，由于Steam更改商店评测显示规则，挖一下[url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/fenxer/recommended/511470/]芬哥的高雅分析[/url]。

拼玻璃游戏，第一关就是法国，谜底也是Art Deco/装饰派艺术，游戏的灵感来源于此。不过本作并不是全球艺术风格/名作之旅，而是以装饰派艺术形式一图流浏览多国风土人情。

打开游戏的瞬间我秋裤就湿了，视觉上特nia的实在是精致美丽，即便我早知道这是个可以速全成就的休闲游戏，可仍然无法拒绝那闪闪发光晶莹剔透的界面和散落一片的玻璃碴子。

[h1]然而没过半小时，我眉头紧皱，意识到事情并不简单——没错，这休闲游戏开始跑偏了。[/h1]

一开始欧洲几个国家的关卡一切顺利，玻璃碎片的形状相对规则，谜题的图案较好地平衡了文化代表性与辨识度，而且可以较为容易地根据碎片提供的信息推测出图案的大致情况。随着关卡逐渐远离欧洲，玻璃碎片几乎要变成玻璃渣，形状也越来越诡异。更尴尬的是，图案的选题与选图开始不那么精妙了，可能是因为许多民族的文化符号从未尝试与装饰派风格结合过，作者缺少资料参考借鉴，以至于谜题图案设计得不够成功，这就直接导致了休闲拼图体验的下降，或者说谜题不再是拼图，而是文物修复，拼图是有趣的，修复是枯燥的。

实际上一开始的谜题提供的玻璃碎片所包含的信息很多，除了形状特征以外还有颜色、内部纹理，甚至可以看出是图案中的哪部分内容。后期关卡显然没能做到这一点，甚至偏离了这一最为精彩的设计思路，于是碎片就是碎片，很多时候碎片之间除了形状契合就再没有其他关系了。

日本谜题图案是艺伎。恩？说起日本谁会先想到艺伎啊？？？显然应该是[spoiler]浮世绘[/spoiler]啊。
加拿大是鹤。额，长知识也不亏。
格陵兰是哈士奇。

[spoiler]我似乎知道为什么它会是玻璃碎片了。[/spoiler]

33548553.review:
I got this on the summer sale, and I'm really glad I picked it up. I figured it'd be a nice puzzle game when I wanted to waste some time and it's perfect for that. I haven't played it all the way through, but it seems fairly short over all, which saddens me because the puzzles are beautiful and the theme is really nice. I love that the clocks are in different shapes, and you can spin the 'wheels' on the side with the pieces to find one you want. Also really like that the pieces are just shapes until you select them to try them, and then the color/pattern is revealed. It's a very relaxing game and I found myself just wanting to continue and put them all together. I made myself stop though, to save some for another time. 
Overall the puzzes, even when ranked 'difficult' aren't terribly hard. Some def make you think longer and mess with the pieces, but they're all doable and nothing is so exasperating that you can't manage it. I also liked trying to figure out what the picture was as it was taking shape.  I really hope they come out with more like this, since it's really a very beautiful and relaxing puzle game.

33259604.review:
Glass Masquerade (which I'm very tempted to shorten to "Glassquerade") is undeniably a gorgeous game, that much can be said without question. But underneath the spectacle of the visuals, this is a very solid game about putting together fantastical stained-glass jigsaw puzzles -- and for the TL;DR: I recommend it highly to anyone who enjoys this style of game.

The mechanics are as simple as drag and drop. One thing I appreciated about Glass Masquerade was the way in which puzzle pieces are managed. Rather than having the pieces in a jumble under the puzzle space, they're instead housed in a scrollable wheel around the puzzle -- and frankly it's the best system I've ever seen, because it negates the issue of being unable to find a piece because it's under something else and simplifies a lot of the headache that can come from trying to organize your pieces. It was a very welcome surprise!

The music is fitting and unobtrusive as well, and it complements the experience without grating on my nerves even after staring uncomprehendingly at a blank spot in the middle of the puzzle for an extended length of time. Beyond the occasional quibble of inadvertently moving the wheel of puzzle pieces instead of grabbing the one I wanted (or vice versa,) I really have no complaints with this game whatsoever. It's a joy to play.

Because the game is so simple, it needed to get all the little details right -- and in my opinion it has. It's very satisfying to play, and finally placing down that last piece to see the full artwork is always gratifying. If you like jigsaw puzzles or puzzles in general, I would recommend giving Glass Masquerade a try -- it's a feast for the eyes, a fun diversion for the mind, and overall a well-priced, welcome additon to just about anyone's library.

33248894.review:
I came across this beautiful little gem while I was browsing for bargains during the summer sale. I have to say, this game didn't disappoint me like a few other bargains did. Essentially, it's a glorified jigsaw puzzle game, with each country (25 countries total, I think) having a puzzle of their own you must complete. The image pertains to something about the country, such its past, tourist attractions, etc. 

After you complete each artpiece you are taken back to the map to pick your next destination. The game isn't entirely linear, as you have a path you can follow, which branches off to various countries and regions. You can choose whatever direction you'd like, or even backtrack to another area. Also, each puzzle is rated in difficulty from one to five, so you'll have an idea of how long it will take.

To boot, getting the achievements is easy. You get one for each country you complete. So, if you're looking for a 'perfect' game, with all achievements completed, then this one may pique your interest.

The game has soothing music, which sometimes varies according to where you are in the world. And, the visuals are really nice. The game overall is very relaxing, even when doing the most difficult puzzles. 

Really, the only con about this game, which is minor, is that the pieces are just a bit larger when you pick them up, which makes finding the right spot sometimes slightly more challenging. 

Overall, I recommend this game, especially if you love beautiful visuals, art, country related themes, jigsaw puzzles, and/or something casual to unwind with.

The game is stunning, easy to play/pick up, and while the puzzles get progressively harder, none of them made me want to throw things. Ranging from about 5 minutes, to about 30 minutes, the puzzles are visually stunning, and made me think about picking up stained glass classes just to make one or two of the featured clocks!

This game is very meditative, and the music adds to it, making for a mind quieting, peaceful and beautiful experience. I've played through it once, and intend to do it again.

33057754.review:
This was my hidden gem of the 2017 Summer Sale. It gave me that Pandora's Box vibe that I've longed to feel, since that old puzzle game had a charm of relaxing discovery that no game has come close to recreating, to say nothing about surpassing it. I wish someone would make a spiritual successor already...

Still, my double thumbs-up comes with a few caveats (don't let them dissuade you from playing the game!).

First of all, the art style can sometimes be detrimental to the game. There are rare times when the sheen and colour composition can make it difficult to discern which spaces are empty and which are not. It's not bad, more like a little too much of a good thing, maybe.

Secondly, the clock-like play area wasn't such a hot idea in retrospect. Each puzzle has you place stained glass fragments within a given clock-like object - a novel idea, but it feels a bit forced and constraining. It doesn't really add anything to the game other than making the play area even more visually busy than it already is.

Finally, the puzzle mechanics don't seem to lend themselves to increased scope. I realize the puzzles were intended to be solved blind with a small number of pieces, but I imagine solving anything with more pieces could be an exercise in frustration. These stained glass puzzles lend themselves to unorthodox pieces composition, so there is some potential there for unique puzzle-solving experiences.

Despite all of the above nitpicks, I wholeheartedly recommend the game to any puzzle afficionado in search of something relaxing and a little off the beaten path. I'm looking forward to what the devs cook up next.

32965275.review:
[h1][Introduction][/h1]
I would like to start this review with saying that I’m usually not really into puzzle games, let alone games with actual puzzle pieces, the majority of those are just boring to me. But this one seems to be special, it just hit me when I saw the trailer and screenshots; I guess the aesthetic and audio just spoke to me.

As in all my reviews, these are my own opinions and experiences, please check out other reviews too!

[h1][Negatives/Suggestions][/h1]
Puzzle pieces are slightly larger when you pick them up, this can result in frustration and confusion when you just can’t find the right spots. Some keys or arrows would’ve been nice to turn the piece tray without the needing to grab it. Spinning it happen often accidentally when you just want to grab a piece. 

Having to pick up the pieces in order to see the colors can be a bit tiresome if you’re looking for distinct colors, an option to at least slightly see the color would be cool. The game is simply too short and can be finished in around 3-4 hours which was a bit disappointing; I was hoping for more. New puzzles as DLC or a sequel would be great. An option to show solved puzzles in fullscreen without any UI elements would’ve been a nice add to create pretty screenshots or even wallpapers.

[h1][Gameplay][/h1]
Just what you would expect from a jigsaw puzzle game. Picking up the puzzle pieces to drop them in the right spot to complete the whole picture. There is no time or move limit so this adds to the relaxing atmosphere of the game. What makes it different is that no piece is the same, each one has a different shape and size and the overall puzzle shape varies widely as well.

While most of the game is rather easy, some specific puzzles can be quite challenging; one of them took me 20 minutes to beat it. There are 25 unique puzzles in 25 different countries related to events that happened in said countries. It was fun to guess the picture while getting closer to the reveal.

[h1][Graphics/Art][/h1]
This right here is a unique mix of majestically fitting menus mixed together with beautiful stained glass artwork. The whole game is just so mysterious and colorful that it tends to mesmerize you pretty much the whole time. Artworks are based on the specific countries history and pretty much all of them are just a pleasure to look at.

[h1][Music][/h1]
A soundtrack fitting the mysterious nature of the game is also included and helps greatly with creating a relaxing atmosphere. Each section of earth has a proper song with instruments unique to that zone, doing a great job of conveying the part of earth you are currently in.

[url=http://www.nikcomposer.com/]Checkout the composers website for a preview![/url] 

[h1][Conclusion][/h1]
With 3-4 hours playtime, the price is justified in my opinion and this is certainly a pleasure for people who enjoy those kind of games with the added bonus of this also being very relaxing and fun. I recommend this game to anyone who is interested in the game just based on the screenshots and people who are interested in jigsaw puzzle games.

For now, it’s the the best jigsaw puzzle game I’ve ever seen. The authentic and artistic combination of instrumental music and stained glass art is just too lovely!

32172085.review:
Sviluppato da [h1]Onyx Lute[/h1] e rilasciato nel 2016,  [h1]Glass Masquerade [/h1] è un puzzle game dove il vostro scopro sarà ricomporre delle vetrate usando dei pezzi di vetro, come se fossero un puzzle, quindi dovrete incastrare i pezzi nel posto giusto.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Vi ritroverete nella International Times Exhibition, una specie di evento che mette in mostra varie opere del mondo, sempre con il tema dei vetri colorati. Quindi avrete una mappa con varie nazioni che man mano sbloccherete completando le vetrate.

Le nazioni sono 25, ed ogni nazione avrà la sua vetrata caratteristica, con qualcosa che la rappresenti, come ad esempio, l'Italia con le maschere veneziane oppure la Britannia con il classico Sherlock Holmes. E' una cosa che mi è piaciuta molto quella di abbinare qualcosa di caratteristico ad ogni vetrata, un'ottima scelta degli sviluppatori.

La difficoltà del gioco non è troppo  alta, anzi è un puzzle game abbastanza semplice.I pezzi di solito variano dai 25 ai 61, in base al puzzle che farete, ed ogni vetrata ha delle stelline che ne indicano la difficoltà, si parte dalle 3 stelle e si arriva fino alle 5. Ovviamente quelli a 5 stelle sono i più complessi e grandi.Inoltre avrete un piccolo aiuto quando inizierete la vetrata, il gioco v'indicherà con dei pallini la posizioni di qualche pezzo per darvi una base, poi dovrete sbrigarvela da soli e comporre il resto.

Come controlli non ho avuto alcun problema, anche se qualche volta i pezzi si bloccavano e non riuscivo più a muovere il mouse, quindi mi toccava uscire col tasto start e rientrare, non so se sia un problema accaduto solo a me, però niente di grave.

[h1] Grafica e Soundtrack [/h1]

Parlando dei disegni, ogni vetrata è davvero fantastica.Il lavoro e l'impegno dietro degli sviluppatori si nota fin da subito, perché ogni vetrata è sempre più particolare dell'altra e molto bella da vedere e sia da comporre.Si nota molto lo stile dèco con le sue linee a zig zag  caratteristiche ed i colori nero ed oro molto accentuati.

Tutto molto bello da vedere ed accompagnato alla perfezione da un'ottima soundtrack di sottofondo composta da  Nikita Sevalnev. Un bravissimo artista che riesce ad accompagnare tutto lo stile rilassante che il gioco trasmette.

[h1] Piccolo commento finale con Pro e Contro [/h1]

[b]Pro[/b]

[list]
    [*]Vetrate davvero ben curate e belle
    [*]Un gameplay semplice ma piacevole 
    [*]Un'ottima soundtrack d'accompagnamento
    
[/list]

[b]Contro[/b]

[list]
[*]Necessitava una piccola sfida in più
[*]Qualche problema con i comandi ed il trascinamento dei pezzi

[/list]

Il gioco è molto piacevole da giocare e perfetto per riempire un pomeriggio di noia. Anche se un po' troppo semplice, da comunque una certa sfida su alcune vetrate che sono più complicate di altre, anche se sostanzialmente rimane un gioco corto.Graficamente molto piacevole e a livello sonoro rilassante, con ottimi pezzi musicali e belle vetrate che rappresentano le nazioni.Un'esperienza molto gradevole ed economica!

31658091.review:
[h1]游戏让我快乐[/h1]


[h1]入手经过[/h1]
这款游戏刚出的时候，看动态就有不少好友入手了，加上评价一直很好，就加入到愿望单，点了关注。
最近游戏进了Indie gala慈善包，虽然包里绿了好几个游戏，但是为了它，还是决定忍痛入了一包。
[spoiler]我是穷人，基本不会原价购，半价打折我都要思量半天，就是入了包，我也会考虑再三。。[/spoiler]
这两天挤出时间玩了一下，感觉非常棒，绝对物超所值，特写个评测推荐给大家！

这款游戏应该是Steam上我玩过的最好玩的拼图类游戏了。没有之一。
当然我玩的游戏不多，若言语失当，触怒了各位心目中的神作，这里抱歉了。
但是起码对我来说，游戏品质非常棒，而且玩起来成就感满满。

[h1]不急不躁，功成圆满。[/h1]
拼图游戏可以考验人的耐心，对锻炼人的脾气和涵养很有帮助，一直都被认为是老少咸宜的休闲益智游戏。
但是现在好多拼图游戏，完全脱离了休闲益智的本意，达到选择走极端困难路线。

那些拼图游戏，不弄得玩家精疲力竭不算完。
不是拼图达人，或者是记忆力超凡的高手，还经常弄得玩家不得不放弃，半途而废。
这样成就感完全是负值，只有满满的挫败感。
玩到让你怀疑你的智商，这样哪里还有休闲益智的意思？
当然游戏开发者可能只是想留住核心向玩家吧，增加游戏耐玩性和生命。

只是这样的做法，我是无法苟同。
好吧，我就不是拼图核心玩家。
本来买个游戏就是为了玩的开心，益智就不强求了，只求别再伤害我的脑细胞啦。
毕竟大多数玩家都不是游戏达人，也不想消磨太多时间。
那样只会对那款游戏产生畏惧感，除开核心向玩家，不然再次游戏的机会更是少之又少。
真核心向玩家可能更喜欢购买实物拼图游戏吧。

这款游戏就不然，难度设计非常合理。
不会让人拼图拼的心烦气躁，也不会简单到感觉没有挑战性。
让不怎么玩拼图游戏的我都感觉成就感爆棚。
大约拼完一幅图不会花费超过15分钟。
简直就是杀磨零碎时间的快乐时光。

[h1]画面和音乐[/h1]
游戏画面很赞，刚开始觉得玻璃纹路有些光怪陆离的感觉，但还不至于说无法接受，后面更是越玩越赞。
对于好多画面过于简陋，UI非常糟糕的拼图类游戏来说，这款游戏在画面和UI上来说称得上上乘之作。
很多配图都很契合各个国家的文化，比如中国的就是龙凤呈祥的拼图图案。
对于好些国家的拼图图案不太了解，有些可惜。
如果有达人懂得这些配图含义，还请指教下我，谢谢！

音乐也很棒，拼图时没有刺激大脑的感觉，有些拼图游戏配音很糟糕。
倒不是说曲目很难听，只是拼图讲究耐心，舒缓的曲目比较合适。
起码不能太嘈杂吧，那样怎么让玩家静心拼图呢，是吧？

上文提到的成就感满满，除开上面说的拼图难度适中、拼图时间不会很长、图案纹路很美外，还有一个就是游戏的成就很棒：
每个国家一副拼图，完成后就解锁相应一个成就，而且是非常精美的国旗成就哦
一面面的小国旗成就图标，看着就让我爱不释手，很漂亮的呢。
这个不买游戏也可以在Steam商店页面看到。大家可以去先睹为快。

[h1]最后说下拼图小技巧吧。[/h1]
1.这款游戏唯一的特色，也是降低难度的关键所在，那就是：
先拼带有小圆环的拼图，对应玻璃图案上的小圆环。颜色跟其他拼图块略有不同，比较醒目。

接下来就是拼图游戏的普通技巧了。
真正放之四海而皆准的拼图秘笈了。
简单说来就是[spoiler]“先边后中，先大后小”。[/spoiler]
这个是我个人总结出来的哦。

下面是细说这条秘笈。
2.先拼边边角角，一般都有比较生硬的切边或者弧线，比较容易拼接。
然后整个轮廓出来后，再拼接里面的图案。

3.先拼大块的拼图，一般形状比较独特，容易拼接，而且大块接好，能增强拼图信心，再耐心拼接小块的拼图。

[h1]一款游戏是否成功，在我看来关键在于能否让玩家快乐，乐在其中，成就感满满。[/h1]
玩这款游戏让我快乐！
希望它也能让你快乐~

31512508.review:
This was a lovely, if brief, puzzle game. I started playing thinking the images would be created from pictures of stained glass creations from all over the world, but it appears that they are all original artwork representative of the various peoples and places. (DLC idea?) The odd shapes that align with the natural divides between pieces of glass add a kinesthetic challenge more complex than the experience of traditional jigsaw-shaped pieces. It was fun to see how often I could see where a piece belonged before clicking on it so it would auto-rotate to the correct orientation, and how often an obvious fit would elude me until I did.

As I see others have noted, the pieces look larger before you place them in the puzzle, which often means they don't look like they will fit. I suspect that this might be intentional, with the solder between the glass pieces being represented both in the pieces already placed and in the loose pieces. It's something that I quickly got used to and was only a significant source of confusion in my first puzzle, but one which I periodically had to consciously compensate for all the way through. I think it has to do with the way the brain interprets shapes as ratios of, say, length to width, while the extra size given to the pieces before their placed does not seem to be proportional. This means that the piece that fits into an opening may seem a lot less "spindly" than the opening itself.

8/10 Would consider buying a DLC and will almost certainly replay the existing levels at some point.



Minor issues directed more at the devs than the players:

I never got the hang of where to click and hold if I want to rotate the unplayed pieces vs where to click and hold to pick up a piece. All the way to the end of the game I was making that error. The hit box for the pieces is larger than the pieces, and the hit box for the inner ring seems to extend into the inner edge of the outer ring. Maybe a grip strip would help clarify?

Early in each round, as you rotate the supply of pieces, the mirrored pieces on the other side of the board rotate along. It took me a little while to realize that each ring was not a single supply of pieces, but that the left and right side of each ring were separate sets of puzzle pieces cycling separately even as they looked like they were cycling together.

On several levels there were pieces of glass dark enough that it wasn't easy to see which parts of the board were unplayed space and which were not. Canada was one where, when placing the final piece, it looked like there were still a few openings and I placed the last piece based on shape. It's a minor thing, but a distinct backdrop texture could allow a better ability to compare shapes without limiting the palette of the final images.

The game reacts a little oddly to an accidental right click while dragging a piece. The piece gets returned to the unplayed supply out of place. The worst effect was when it was placed on top of another unplayed piece, and I could only pick up one of the two. There are no situations in the game where a particular piece has to be played before the other, so once I played the piece that I could pick up I was able to play the other.

[h1][b][Français][/b][/h1]

Glass Masquerade, premier jeu du studio indépendant Onyx Lute, est un puzzle-game au design visuel "vitrail" assez inhabituel.
Avons-nous ici affaire à un jeu de puzzles réussi, ou à un titre dont l'apparence constitue le seul argument?

+ 25 puzzles représentant chacun un pays et sa culture
+ Style visuel très agréable, qui se marie très bien avec la recette du puzzle-game
+ Design et découpage des puzzles très soigné
+ Ambiance et musique relaxante
+ Difficulté des puzzles progressive
+ Système de sélection circulaire des pièces bien pensé
+ Cartes et succès Steam à débloquer

- Trop court (Terminé en moins de 2h30)
- Le placement des pièces peut sembler un peu trop millimétré par moments

Glass Masquerade est une excellente surprise, et assurément un coup de cœur personnel.

D'un point de vue esthétique, qu'on apprécie ou pas le design vitrail, il faut bien reconnaître que les puzzles sont très ouvragés.
Les pièces sont bien découpées, et le système de sélection circulaire autour du puzzle fonctionne bien; il est possible de faire défiler ces anneaux pour sélectionner d'autres pièces.
Le dépaysement culturel est appréciable; 25 pays abordés, soit autant de thèmes visuels.
Sa bande son relaxante et son absence de score ou de chronomètre permettent au joueur de prendre son temps et de se focaliser sur le travail apporté aux puzzles.  

Onyx Lute a également eu le bon goût de ne pas mettre systématiquement en avant des lieux communs culturels déjà vus et revus. 
Par exemple, le premier puzzle du jeu représente la France, et le sujet n'est pas la Tour Eiffel pour autant.

Reste que le jeu est assez court, et ne proposera pas de rejouabilité spécifique, si ce n'est pour profiter à nouveau de la beauté des artworks.
Pour moins de 5€, il reste néanmoins un bon investissement pour qui souhaite s'offrir une pause détente bénéficiant d'un style novateur.

Note: Le Humble Store vous permet d'obtenir la clé Steam et la version DRM-free (Téléchargeable et utilisable en-dehors de Steam).

[h1][b][English][/b][/h1]

Glass Masquerade -the first game of the indie studio Onyx Lute- is a puzzle-game with a pretty uncommon stained-glass visual design.
Are we talking about a successful game or about a title which only selling point lies in its graphics?

+ 25 puzzles that each represent a country and its culture
+ Very pleasant design that really matches well with the puzzle-game genre
+ Carefully designed and cut up bits
+ Relaxing atmosphere and music
+ Progressive difficulty
+ Well-thought circular bits selection system
+ Steam cards and achievements to unlock

- Too short (Completed under 2h30)
- Bits placing system can seem too much accurate sometimes

Glass Masquerade is an excellent surprise and most certainly a personnal crush.

On an aesthetic point of view, even if you don't like the stained-glass design you need to admit that those puzzles are very finely worked.
The bits are well cut up and the circular selection system around the puzzles works great. You can scroll through those rings to select other bits.
The cultural change of scenery is a real plus: 25 countries tackled and as many visual themes.
Its relaxing atmosphere and the absence of score or timer allow the player to take his/her time and to focus on the care provided to the puzzles.

Onyx Lute has had the good taste not to stress commonplaces that we all know by heart.
For instance, the first puzzle of the game represents France, and the topic of the puzzle isn't necessarily the Eiffel Tower.

Despite these good aspects the game is pretty short and won't offer any other specific replayability than enjoying the beauty of the artworks.
For less than 5€ it is nevertheless a good investment for people looking for a relaxing break with an innovative style.

31465085.review:
If you like jigsaw puzzles, you'll love this game. It's the perfect casual game. The soundtrack is beautiful and is perfect background music for puzzling action. The gameplay consists of putting pieces of a stained glass puzzle, which are blacked out so you can't see their colour and are rotated at a random angle until you pick them up so you can't eyeball their placement in the puzzle, into a puzzle area. Basically a stained glass jigsaw puzzle. It's a really refreshing take on the jigsaw puzzle genre that left me wanting more.

Pros:
- Beautiful art
- Amazing soundtrack
- Gameplay so fun I wanted more when I was finished the game

Cons
- Occasionally awkward controls: Sometimes, when attempting to rotate the puzzle area so different pieces are viewable, I ended up picking up a piece instead. Just a minor annoyance more than anything since the stages don't have time limits.
- Lack of options for a different gameplay experience (e.g. turn on colour fill for pieces, turn off pre-rotation of pieces)

Overall the pros FAR outway the cons, which are minor annoyances.

Seriously, if you love jigsaw puzzles get this game. You'll love it and it will leave you wanting more in this style.

31415719.review:
[b]如何拼图？[/b]
首先，你要找到这张拼图的“突破点”（一般是拼图的边边角角区域），然后，找出和“突破点”相近并缺口对应的拼图；刚开始可能会觉得这个拼图难，但别着急，慢慢的找出“突破点”，慢慢对照和拼，总会拼完的~（现实中完成过300个碎片的拼图的我如是说）

[b]并不难的拼图[/b]
这个拼图游戏并不难，只要你找到了拼图的“突破点”就好，而且拼图的“突破点”很好找，每张拼图总有圈圈和带有圈圈的碎片，那可以算是“突破点”，优先拼好可以降低之后的难度。虽说是不难，但对于第一次接触拼图的玩家来说还是有点难度的，但就算如此，也只不过比拼过图的玩家多花几分钟。我虽然对拼图有一点了解，但因为我是每日拼一点，所以进度比其他玩家慢。

[b]风格各异的玻璃拼图[/b]
这个游戏里的总体拼图风格为教堂的彩色玻璃风格，单个拼图是按照相应国家比较突出的特点来设计；每个拼图的图案都不一样，一个国家只有一张拼图有点少，但这游戏一共25个国家。
不过更重要的是你发掘这国家拼图的过程：一开始拼时你根本不能从碎片里得知这是什么，也没有任何缩略图，随着一个个碎片放到正确的位置，拼图的原型越来越清晰，当你拼完一个拼图时，你会恍然大悟，原来这个国家的风格是这样的啊～

[b]便宜又多的拼图[/b]
这个游戏正常价格也就21元，却能获得这么多的拼图，可以说是血赚：再次拿我现实中那一共有300个碎片的图案来说吧，这个拼图花了我88块钱，而且我只买了1个……不过相对而言，拼图的碎片量就少了，最多也就大约50块碎片吧，没有300块那样刺激；但想想这游戏的碎片形状……算了，300个碎片要拼到什么时候，50个对新人都是个考验了。

steam上的拼图游戏千千万（no…），但我推荐拼图新手第一个买这个，初步了解拼图的同时还能了解各国文化；此外，非拼图爱好玩家也推荐入手，毕竟有国旗成就。

31180527.review:
W układaniu puzzli jest coś odprężającego. W zasadzie jedyną wadą tego hobby jest to, że nie zawsze jest miejsce lub warunki, żeby zostawić niedokończoną układankę na później. Ba, jeśli w ogóle możesz sobie pozwolić na taką sytuację – to już jest swego rodzaju luksus. Odkąd zaczęto adaptować tę rozrywkę na grunt komputerowy, producenci mieli ułatwione zadanie. Oferowali graczowi całe mnóstwa obrazów i wzorów w jednym miejscu, możliwość podzielenia ich na różne ilości kawałków, opcje zapisu gry, układanie na czas, rankingi – generalnie wszystko, co mogłoby zachęcić fana puzzli, by sięgnąć po dany tytuł. Dodatkowo wraz z rozwojem technologii gry tego typu zaczęły wyglądać coraz lepiej, a twórcy nie szczędzili ciekawych chwytów, by przyciągać kolejnych odbiorców. W ten sposób dochodzimy do Glass Masquerade.

Gra składa się z 25 układanek nawiązujących stylistyką do Art déco. Żeby było ciekawiej, układanymi obrazami są witraże, których zawartość stara się odzwierciedlić przypisany kraj. Puzzle mają swoje stopnie trudności, charakteryzujące się liczbą elementów potrzebnych do ułożenia obrazka. Jednym z pomysłów na wydłużenie rozgrywki jest zakrycie całego witrażu. Przy pierwszym podejściu nie mamy wglądu w to, co układamy. Mało tego, same elementy również pozostają zakryte. Dopiero wzięcie danego kawałka odsłania go i ustawia w pozycji, w jakiej trzeba go położyć. Trzeba jeszcze brać poprawkę na to, że rozmiar puzzla nie zawsze odpowiada temu na planszy, ale kształt tak.

Oprawa Glass Masquerade po prostu urzeka. Stylistyka jest urocza, obrazy prześliczne, a animacja płynna. Wielu z ruchomych elementów mogłoby w ogóle nie być w grze, ale ich obecność dodaje produkcji smaku i wyrazistości. Całości dopełnia spokojna i relaksująca muzyka.

Jedynym problemem gry jest długość lub stosunek długości do ceny. Wszystkie układanki da się ukończyć w maksymalnie 4 godziny, a i to pod warunkiem, że naprawdę się nie śpieszymy i od razu wyłączymy podpowiedzi dotyczące położenia kilku początkowych kawałków. Po ułożeniu wszystkich obrazków jedyne, co pozostaje, to gra na czas i śrubowanie własnego wyniku. Cena sama w sobie nie jest wygórowana, ale zrozumiałym jest, że ktoś może chcieć poczekać do promocji.

Jeśli jesteście miłośnikami puzzli i szukacie jakiegoś naprawdę ładnego i przyjemnego tytułu, Glass Masquerade jest dla was. Jest to jeden z niewielu przypadków, w którym życzyłbym sobie jakiegoś DLC, albo większego dodatku z nowymi witrażami. Moja ocena: 4+.

http://kresowyblog.blogspot.com/2017/04/glass-masquerade.html

31059736.review:
Recommended.

Story...

There's not much of a story for a pure puzzle game, but I didn't expect anything more. The idea is very simple; explore the world via puzzles. That's it, and it's fine the way it is.

Gameplay...

It was both challenging and rewarding. There were varying difficulties, from three to five - and five being the most challenging. The puzzles had different shapes, which made some of them quite difficult. They certainly were different from normal rectangle ones, for instance. 

There was also this interesting trick. Depending what route you went, you could come across puzzles with the difficulty rate being five. After finishing it and unlocking the next, that puzzle's difficulty could be four. I actually ended enjoying that, since I could test my skill and then relax a bit more with a more easy puzzle.

Art...

The art was really pleasant to look at. As I don't know much about stained glass art, I'm not sure if they are "real" or just made for the game. Either way, they were pretty and I even learned some history from them.

Music...

At first, it annoyed me. The music itself didn't sound bad, but my focus drifted because of it, especially if the puzzle was hard. After I finished the last five puzzles, the music didn't bother me at all.

Conclusion...

It's a nice, short game that can offer either challenge or relaxation. There's no time limits, so there's no need to rush to get that one achievement. You might learn new things from playing the game. However, I think the price is just a bit too high for a game that will take two to three hours to finish. Unless you buy it on sale.

30927230.review:
看到游戏的画风就点进来了，大家的评论是轻松加美丽，当然要买买买。
——然而如果你认为这是个简单的游戏，那么你（很可能）将感受到人生中一次不大不小的挫折。

游戏过程并没有评论里描述的那么惬意……作为太久没接触过这类游戏的拼图苦手，我试着寻找童年满地拼图的记忆……
印象里拼图一般从画框轮廓入手，通过块与块间的色彩和形状联系逐渐推演拓展。而本作里的马赛克玻璃却是明显对颜色近似规则的反叛，两块相邻拼图的颜色经常以对比色甚至互补色出现，试图借由色彩从起点向四周发散的策略通常会铩羽而归，还不如让游戏整体富丽堂皇的金色冲淡自己对颜色的感知，老老实实的以拼块的形状结构作为突破口。
再说形状。
这也是一个溢于言表的坑，因为在拼图过程中，你会发现相邻拼块之间的咬合并不够严密，嵌到画框里的正确拼块会变小那么一丢丢。于是拼到中期，剩余盘面里经常还会存留一些看起来过于硕大以至于在画框里反复游移也找不到任何容身之地的拼块，令人感到难以名状的痛苦与绝望。[spoiler] 当然拼到最后，这些不可能的轮廓也会猝不及防的突然出现，在街角的咖啡店。[/spoiler]因而通过形状入手也不是那么一马平川迎刃而解的。每每想到艺术创造的历程亦是如此曲折蜿蜒，不禁感慨作者给玩家上了如此生动的一堂艺术课QwQ

当哭着拼完印尼那副扭曲的长方形的时候，我长舒了一口气，并怀着对艺术的赞叹与敬畏在心里由衷祈祷作者多一些套路，少一些真诚。

9/10

30896240.review:
I usually avoid buying casual games, because there's a seemingly unlimited supply of free ones, and the simplistic gameplay and objectives usually get repetetive quickly.

This one is something special.  The audio, visuals, and gameplay are all very pleasant and relaxing.  It didn't take me long to finish all the puzzles, but I'm content redoing them.  Maybe I just really like clocks. I've spent a lot of time playing this on my laptop while waiting for appointments, airport layovers, or just trying to fall asleep.

There's a few issues with the game that don't necessarily need fixing, but they do take some getting used to, if you're accustomed to putting together table-top puzzles.  The edges of the puzzle pieces overlap in ways that often make it look like a piece you're holding is too big for the space where it belongs.  Unplaced pieces are only shown as silhouettes.  You can't see what color they are, or their actual size until you're holding them.  Unused pieces snap back to their original place on the wheel when you release them, so you can't group them with similarly colored pieces.  

If they release more puzzle packs as DLC, I'd be happy to continue supporting this one.

30860621.review:
Des puzzles magnifiques, appuyés par une interface efficace.

Je suis une grande amatrice de puzzles version carton. Les quelques versions jeu vidéo que j'ai pu tester avant Glass Masquerade m'avait frustrée: les puzzles géraient mal la taille de l'écran, l'accès aux pièces était lourd et/ou resteint, la taille et forme des pièces demandait au joueur de pointer une loupe sur l'écran et tourner la pièce dans la bonne position devenait vit rageant. Glass masquerade contourne le problème avec un système d'accès aux pièces aux petits ognons, des puzzles de taille réduite et une rotation automatique des pièces. La simplication engendrée par ces choix est en partie compensée par le fait que les pièces, avant leur prise en main, sont dans le mauvais sens et sous forme de silhouettes. En bref, des puzzles plutôt simples mais une prise en main fluide.

Et viens le deuxième point positif, que vous avez déjà pu constater: c'est BEAU! Le jeu est vraiment au niveau de ce qu'il annonce. Mieux encore, la musique, les éléments dynamiques du décor et les menus ajoutent à l'ambiance du titre. C'est superbe.

J'aurais juste aimé davantage de puzzles. Quand c'est bon comme ça, on en veut forcément plus.

Remarque: à jouer sans indices, ou le jeu passe de simple à trop facile

I have been waiting for a long time for this Game to go on sale and I must say that it really is a hidden Gem.

Let me point out first that this Game is rather unique and I havent seen anything quite like this here on Steam.

Glass Masquerade is a relaxed Puzzle Game with a beautiful vibrant Art Style and very calming atmospheric Music. Although it has different difficulties the Puzzles are never to hard and wont take longer them approximatlly 15 Minutes (per super hard puzzle). 

I personally am a big Fan of Jigsaw Puzzles like Pixel Puzzles however Pixel Puzzles just doesn't have the same atmosphere and gorgeousness of this Game. I was rather surprised how different those 2 were.

The only thing I saw as negative is that there were far to less Puzzles and I would off liked to see more.

Personally I really loved and enjoyed this Game every little bit and I wish that Onyx Lute would make another Game like this, although they are an Indie Studio.

I also would love to see a Soundtrack available for purchase, as I wasnt able to find it anywhere on youtube.

I do recommend this Game to any achievement Hunter as it is not very Hard to complete it, but unlike the zup games you actually get a proper gaming experience here.

I also do recommend this Game to any Puzzle Fan.

In general I would like to mention that you should try this Game out as it really is in my eyes very underrated and underplayed for how amazing it is.

除选项外，几乎没有阅读量。通关大概需要两到三小时。

轻松的氛围，优雅的画面，怡神的音乐，一同构成了这款不同凡响的拼图游戏。你会在整个世界参加巡游，拥有一定的路线选择自由。和传统拼图游戏千篇一律的方形范围相比，每一副拼图几乎都有其独特的布局和形状，使人一口气玩下来也不会有重复无聊的感觉，相反通关后还会觉得意犹未尽，期待探索更多。

29904815.review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title:[/b]  Glass Masquerade
[b]Status:[/b]  Released
[b]Developer:[/b]  Onyx Lute
[b]Publisher:[/b]  Onyx Lute	
[b]Genre:[/b]  Puzzle
[b]Release Date:[/b]  18th of November, 2016
[b]Type:[/b]  Singleplayer 

[h1]General Impression[/h1]
Glass Masquerade should be regarded as a relaxing distraction from all the digital killing encouraged and required by the vast majority of video games nowadays. And even though Steam’s flooded with indie puzzles, Onyx Lute managed to create an artistically unique game which so far has no direct rival for its genre. Bear in mind that this is the dev team’s first released project and you will understand just how promising are both Glass Masquerade and any future titles or direct sequels. Many more countries to visit and visually represent, Onyx.

If you’re attracted to stained glass and/or Art Deco like I am, you certainly don’t need a lot of convincing before you actually purchase this game. If you’re relatively new to art and architecture, I shall provide some context for both the terms I mentioned earlier. Stained (or colored) glass has been invented and perfected over the course of several centuries starting from the Middle Ages. It is an art form closely associated with religion and places of worship, but fortunately in our present times, this particular type of glasswork has been used in a larger spectrum, from intricate objects (such as the clocks simulated in this title) to lamp shades. I won’t bore you with the production details, but as you can imagine, it takes great skill and effort to produce or maintain/repair stained glass.

Art Deco is my favorite architectural style. Evocative of a bold new direction in design and while it was first shown in 1925’s Paris, Art Deco is the visual representation of urban progress in many American cities of the 1930s and predominantly, New York. Of course by the start of World War II, Deco design was implemented everywhere from household appliances to means of transportation. A bygone era in which Bugatti was still an original French symbol for automotive art and luxury. In fact, nearly all cars manufactured in the ‘30s were influenced by Art Deco regardless of their brand.

So you have an art house 2D puzzle video game which is filled to the brim with eye candy, without being perceived as ostentatious. All that Glass Masquerade needed now is a topic that its Steam counterparts rarely feature. Animals, plants or cars and ships were out of the picture. What about national symbolism? Yes, that would be quite fitting for the visual style and remain a novelty at the same time. And so it was decided that the puzzles you need to assemble shall address symbolism itself. On an international scale, since the game features 25 nations from all over the globe. You have a puzzle clock for each and every such nation, with no apparent reason for their selection by the dev team. I’m certain that there isn’t a single country on Earth who wouldn’t have enough cultural merit, worthy of being put on display for all to admire. The only problem for Glass Masquerade would be that once you’re done completing those 25 unique clocks, there isn’t any replay value to be found. So perhaps (free) DLC with more nations or a sequel are to be expected once the game reaches the recognition it deserves.

The gameplay mechanics of a classical puzzle game are self-explanatory, don’t you agree? I shall focus instead on the interesting assistance you receive from the game, after you start assembling a new national clock. You have so-called “hooks” for the first few puzzle pieces on the edges, just enough to form an outline and guide you towards piecing together the entire thing, in a timely manner. The developer estimates that it takes around 4 hours to finish all the 25 nations but I think a keen eye coupled with a sharp mind could accomplish this mission in just over 3 hours. Perhaps replay value might stem from attempting to beat your initial time of puzzle completion. They do vary in complexity/difficulty as far as I’ve noticed so far. Overall, Glass Masquerade is worthy of any Steam game collection and it just might be a game in which all players can receive a full set of Achievements, once they finish it. Trading Cards should be implemented too but even at its current price tag, the game is nothing short of great value. Have a break from all that frenetic shooting and relax while admiring art and national symbols.

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Gorgeous visual style.
+ Relaxing gameplay.
+ Steam Achievements & Trading Cards.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- No replay value.


[b]Rating 80/100 [/b]

The basic mechanics are easy and simple, just pick up pieces and have them match up inside the stained glass clock. 

There are a few issues however:

- Sometimes the area where you pick up puzzles will just randomly spin out of control when you try and drag a piece. Strange but can be overlooked, even if it's annoying.
- The pieces will fit in awkwardly and don't appear to fit in. You'll see if you play it.

It's a nice game and worth a buy.

29480414.review:
[quote]完整图文内容请查看[url=https://cowlevel.net/game/b6689e976fcb13b338fd17158e97c670/review/2172886]奶牛关[/url][/quote]

本作是以20世纪一些艺术装饰风格（Art Deco）和彩绘玻璃（Stained Glass）艺术家们的作品为视觉灵感来源所做的一个puzzle game。虽然玩法是拼图的感觉，但是由于其奇特的拼块分割方式、幽然平静的OST和华丽的视觉风格，使其游戏品质在众多拼图游戏中鹤立鸡群。

游戏的起点是法国，这点的特殊意义在于Art Deco的“起源”在于这里。虽然Art Deco的演变纵横多个时期、文化和国度，但是其第一次以名字意义的出现是在1925年在巴黎举行的“现代工业和装饰艺术博览会”（Exposition Internationale des Arts Décoratifs et Industriels Modernes）。

Art Deco的装饰有下列几个主要的特征：

放射状的太阳光与喷泉形式：象征了新时代的黎明曙光。
摩天大楼退缩轮廓的线条：二十世纪的象征物。
速度、力量与飞行的象征物：交通运输上的新发展。
几何图形：象征了机械与科技解决了我们的问题。
新女人的形体：透露了女人赢得了社会上的自由权利。
打破常规的形式：取材自爵士、短裙与短发、震撼的舞蹈等等。
古老文化的形式：对埃及与中美洲等古老文明的想象。
明亮对比的色彩。

令人惊奇的是这些特征都会在游戏中彩绘玻璃这一材质上一一体现。每一个国家的图案都代表着这个国家历史标志性的事物与文化，横跨古今：古有墨西哥的玛雅文化，今有英国的夏洛克…

游戏中的拼块分割都处于各个玻璃色块的衔接铅条之间，并处理成镀金的光效以适应整体superb风格。这点是我认为游戏最有趣也是最精华之处所在。早期Stained Glass的制作程序中，黑色的铅条作为各种色彩的玻璃衔接出现，形成了平面上的粗线。虽然是物理上的粗线，但是在这里反而表现成了几何上的线条，而线条对于艺术的表现力不必多言。Glass Masquerade的拼块分割在于这些线条之间，对比普通拼图游戏的为了提高游戏难度而使用的无脑切割方法，在本作的拼图过程中让人有一种“亲手绘制”的感觉。Stained Glass的艺术表现形式打破了以往拼图游戏近色块相聚的方法，你可能永远也猜不出这块深蓝色的拼块相邻的是闪耀的黄色。

如今，关于glass的设计已经被编入像包豪斯这种欧洲顶级设计学院的教学大纲当中。美国建筑大师Frank Lloyd Wright和爱尔兰的Harry Clarke在Stained Glass现代发展中都有着卓越的贡献……

本作中一共有25个国家即25种图案，虽然有时候你会发现某些拼块不按套路出牌，但在发现一定对称规律后，本着对图形的敏感我们可以自己凭空找出一些拼块位置……

【此处假装有图】

如上图中的“糖果”状图形即是根绝左右颜色的渐变划分与整体对称结构看出的大概所在位置，下面类似“领带”的形状紧接其后。这种从个体色块到整体信息传递的往复认知过程，以及最后“会当凌绝顶”、沁心欣赏全图的惊艳感，大概是这个游戏最有趣的地方了。

如果单从拼图游戏的游戏性方面来说，Glass Masquerade可谓是比较简单的——

首先每个拼块的方向性是确定的；
没有时间限制（指针除了代表物体的表述时间性质外，大概只是一个给画面带来“运动”的元素罢了）；
起始局面有边缘拼块提醒，再一次降低了门槛；
即使是最高难度，拼块数量也比较偏少；
即使是尚未拼完的图案也别有一番美感；
多样化的拼盘。

轻松的上手加上舒服的交互和沉浸感，虽然想每个图案都细细品味一番，但一玩起来便停不下来了……

本想把每个图案与国家的联系都大概写一下，[spoiler]比如为什么葡萄牙的图案是个大帆船？[/spoiler]但是感觉这样会有失游戏体验。所以如果在游戏中对哪个国家图案有所疑问的话，手动查询一下也能获得不少游戏外的知识呢。

玻璃假面舞会，一起来在艺术中起舞吧~

29470658.review:
PROS:
+ Simple and doesn't require a time commitment 
+ Very colorful and has some amazing designs on the clock faces
+ Rexlaxing (although puzzles DO record how long it takes for you to complete them, time records are there for you and not meant to make you rush)
+ Low system requirements, so even an underpowered laptop could handle it
+ For this type of puzzle game, the options menu has a lot of features in it
+ Steam Cloud
+ Inexpensive at $4.99 USD (although I purchased it on sale at $3.74 USD)

CONS:
- Almost too simple and straightforward
- Very short (I literally finished the entire game in four hours and I was taking my time) although the store page makes note of this itself, so it shouldn't come as a surprise
- No alternative modes of play
- Not immediately obvious where every puzzle piece goes (as in some clocks have pieces that go on or around the outside of the clock while others don't)
- No reference images to work from, so you're walking into each puzzle blind
- Puzzle pieces aren't always "to scale" so sometimes the piece will fit into a slot that's smaller than it looks

RECOMMEND: Yes. Despite there being some drawbacks to the game, it's a fun, very nice-looking title that's relaxing and easy to learn.

28738275.review:
This game is a classic jigsaw puzzle game. I would certainly recommend it, but at a discount. Here is the practical breakdown:

CONS:
1. The game is too easy and short. No piece rotation and odd boarder shapes made it not challenging
2. There are no difficulty settings, so you can't make the puzzles harder by having it broken into more pieces
3. Pieces do not exactly match the openings they fit in. If it kinda looks like it fits, try it.
4. The pieces are in rings that spin. This is more annoying then helpful and sometime the wheels spin on one side and not the other to reveal other pieces you did not know were hiding.

PROS:
1. Absolutely beautiful. I would actually love to have a time piece that looked like some of these.
2. The shapes of the pieces were also interesting making the game more engaging.
3. The music was relaxing and changed from location to location to prevent it from being too repetitive
4. Puzzles were stylistic representations of something having to do with the country they are for as did some of the music

***RECOMENDATION***
1. In the settings for the game, make sure you deselect the starting clues. The game was already too easy. I cannot imagine how much faster it would have been with help.

All in all, I really enjoyed the experience of piecing these beautiful artistic works together. If you are in the mood for something quick and visual, this is it.

首先说明游戏是sg上中奖获得的。
一款单纯的拼图游戏，一共25关，每关拼图块数大概是30-70这样吧，个人每关完成时间大概是简单的3分钟左右，中等的5-8分钟，比较难的10-13分钟，用时最多的一关是17分钟，通关时间将近3个半小时。
相比比较有名的puzzle agent系列，本游戏拼图块数要少很多，但这并不意味着游戏会过于简单。每块拼图的大小，形状都很不规则，同时比例会有所偏差，实际放入后会比看上去的要小一些；拼图的花纹能够提供的提示很少（因为就算是完成的拼图我都几乎看不懂..），基本都是靠形状对比来完成拼图。感觉puzzle agent更多的是考验耐心和对图案的记忆，而本游戏则是考验对形状的记忆，同时每关相对短的耗时也让玩家能享受更流畅的游戏体验。
音乐很不错，拼图图案有各个国家的特色（虽然我几乎都不认识），看上去很精致。
我作为一个身经百战的喜加一党，横向对比其他游戏，给出的心理价位是5元。当然喜欢的话不必太在意价格。

스테인글라스 그림이 아름답다. 게임 초반에 몇 개의 귀퉁이 조각들은 넌지시 알려주니 게임 진행이 한 층 편해진다. 가끔 맞춰야 하는 조각의 크기와 실제 구멍의 크기가 살짝 다르게 느껴질 때가 있어 헷갈릴 때가 있긴 하다만, 조금만 침착하게 퍼즐을 풀어나가다보면 전부 무난하게 풀리는 수준. (항상 스테인글라스 게임들 보면서, 저런 그림은 대체 어떻게 그려내는 건지 궁금해진다.) 게다가 퍼즐만 부지런히 맞추면 모든 도전과제를 다 딸 수 있으니 도전과제 파밍용으로도 베리 굿인 게임이다.

총 25가지의 각 나라를 컨셉으로 한 그림이 준비되어있다. 퍼즐을 맞추고 나면 나름 각 나라를 상징하는 아름다운 스테인그라스 그림이 완성된다. 이쯤에서 사소한 불만 하나. 한국이 없다. 일본, 중국도 있고 어디 마다카스타르나 그린란드 같은 곳도 있는데 한국이 없다. 너무한거 아닙니까, 이거. 무료 dlc를 통해서라도 한국 스테이지가 추가됐으면 좋겠다.

어쨌든 꽤나 깔끔하게 잘 만들어진 직소 퍼즐 게임이다. 늘상 그렇듯 퍼즐 갯수가 좀만 더 많았으면 좋았을 것 같고, 나중에 사운드트랙이나 별도로 좀 나와줬으면 좋겠다.

http://blog.naver.com/kitpage/220867671679

A short and simple game, but also very pretty and satisfying. At its core, Glass Masquerade is a basic jigsaw puzzle game, but the stained glass aesthetic really makes this game stand out. If you think you would enjoy the game, you will probably enjoy the game.

The only significant problem the game has is that the pieces overlap a bit on the board. This means that, if a piece is supposed to fill a small gap, that gap might not even be visible on the board because of the other pieces filling it in a bit. it's something you'll get used to by the end, but do bear it in mind if you play the game yourself.

39414658.review:
Glass Masquerade est un puzzle game à l'esthétisme élégante, qui vous invite à reconstituer 25 vitraux brisés, dont le design est inspiré de la culture d'un pays...

Les mécaniques fonctionnent bien, et on parvient assez rapidement à reconstituer les dessins de verre, malgré la forme des pièces parfois bien biscornues...
Chaque niveau prend entre 90 secondes à 15 min grand max, amenant le jeu à une durée de vie d'environ 3 à 4h.
Les musiques ne sont pas inoubliables, mais pas désagréables non plus, et elles vous accompagneront discrètement durant ces quelques heures, sans avoir le temps de devenir lassantes.

Pas grand chose à reprocher à ce jeu plutôt sympathique et bien réalisé, en revanche, j'avoue que certains détails provoquent une certaine incompréhension de ma part :

Au delà du fait que chaque vitrail s'avère en réalité être une horloge sans que cela n'ait d'explication ou même d'influence sur le gameplay, c'est surtout les concepts relatifs à la difficulté qui me paraissent étranges.

La difficulté de chaque niveau est indiquée par une graduation sur 5 étoiles. On commence en Europe avec des niveaux de difficulté 3 sur 5, qui ouvrent ensuite d'autres voies vers des puzzles de difficulté 4 sur 5, & 5 sur 5.
Mais à aucun moment on ne croise de puzzle de difficulté 1 sur 5, ou 2 sur 5. Du coup, quel est l’intérêt de noter la difficulté sur une échelle de 5 au lieu d'une échelle de 3?

De plus, au fil des voies dévoilées au fur et à mesure de l'avancée, on tombe sur des niveaux de difficulté inférieure aux précédents, ce qui me semble assez bizarre en terme de progression.

Ce n'est pas vraiment problématique dans la mesure ou en réalité, cette note de "difficulté" est sans doute plutôt un indicateur du nombre de pièces, et donc du temps qui sera nécessaire à l'assemblage... (En terme de difficulté proprement dite, certains puzzles 5 sur 5 m'ont semblé plus simples que certains 4 sur 5 par exemple - mais ils "durent" simplement plus longtemps).

Terminer le jeu permettra de déverrouiller 100% de ses succès, et du coup, la rejouabilité du titre est quasi-nulle - à moins de vouloir battre ensuite ses propres records de vitesse, mais je n'en vois pas trop l’intérêt à vrai dire.

Soldé à 1,74€, ce petit jeu sympa me semble clairement recommandable, et vous fera passer agréablement quelques heures de détente. Au prix fort de 5 euros en revanche, le tarif me semble peut-être un peu surévalué étant donné sa faible durée de vie et sa rejouabilité inexistante.

39351670.review:
Не могу написать на эту игру огромный и подробный обзор, но это не значит, что про нее нечего сказать.
Никогда особо не любила головоломки. Отчасти потому, что не умею я в них, отчасти потому, что нравятся игры куда как поживее. А тут мне подарили "Glass Masquerade". Я посмотрела скриншоты, прежде чем запустить игру, и... буквально влюбилась.
Игра выглядела просто фантастично! Такая яркая, цветастая, теплая и живая. Навевает почему-то мысли о Стране Фей, но это кому как.
И вот, первый запуск вызвал просто всплеск эмоций. Музыка - ненавязчивая, мягкая, и очень приятная. Каждая мелодия соответствует стране (игрок как бы путешествует по карте, и разгадывает головоломку с изображением, перекликающимся с данной страной), так что не попасть в "атмосферу" трудно.
Что радует, пусть в игре и засчитывается время, за сколько игрок собирает головоломку, но это скорее приятное дополнение для себя - можно посмотреть, какой рекорд. Это ни к чему не обязывает, то есть нет такого, что головоломку НУЖНО разгадывать за время. Оно просто засчитывается, и все.
По прохождению игры я искренне пожалела, что нет каких-нибудь тайных уровней, вроде Атлантиды, Эльдорадо и прочих мифических мест. Было бы очень здорово.
И жалко, конечно, что игра такая короткая - после нее хочется еще пройти пару таких головоломок.
Подводя итоги: если хотите ненавязчивой, неторопливой и навевающей почти дзен-буддистское спокойствие, игры - берите, не пожалеете.

39222193.review:
[h1]Glass Masquerade[/h1]

[i]为什么游戏能被人称为第九艺术？Glass Masquerade给出了在视觉艺术上的答案。[/i]
    
    Glass Masquerade是一款拼图游戏，玩家操作手中的玻璃碎片拼接出一块块具有各国特色的花窗玻璃式钟表。
[quote=百度百科]花窗玻璃：西方建筑装饰品，常见于教堂，装置于建物墙面上。
其作用原理是，当日光照射玻璃时，可以造成灿烂夺目的效果。 [/quote]

+一场视觉的盛宴
在四个小时左右的游玩时间里，几乎每一关都在感叹：好美啊~精雕细琢的每一块碎片，流光溢彩的每一幅表面。有的钟表结构对称，严谨统一；有的钟表个性张扬富有冲击力，相同的是每一幅画面的色彩绚丽但不凌乱，显得十分和谐。
[spoiler]Ps.每一幅表盘的表针都是经过精心设计的！给设计师打call[/spoiler]

+一趟文化的旅程
每一幅表面都对应着一个国家的文化特征。[spoiler]eg.中国的雕龙画凤，阴阳交替；美国的自由女神，顶天立地；印度的毗那也迦，跏趺椅立。[/spoiler]每一个国家也有着与之呼应的背景音乐，让玩家领略不同的风光，也消除了审美的疲劳。

+一次舒适的体验
在游玩的过程中能够感受到制作者的诚意，Glass Masquerade作为一款拼图游戏，没有时间限制，也没有胜利失败，制作者完全抛弃了游戏的竞技性，并把它全部赋予了艺术性。这份游戏的纯粹，这份制作的诚意，让玩家放下心中的杂念，静静地欣赏着，慢慢的沉浸着。

-美玉尚有微瑕
游戏的世界地图无法拖动，也无法自动走到下一个关卡，这就让几个处在角落的关卡要通过来回切换才能选中，这让游戏体验打了一点折扣，不过无伤大雅。

写在最后：评分8/10
这是一件纯粹艺术品，且仅售7¥(折后)，可以说是物超所值。
可购入尘封收藏，亦可在需要时平静自己的心灵。

39217282.review:
Ver.1.0.4において約3時間で初見クリア、同時に全実績解除したためレビュー。

[h1]Pros:[/h1][list]
[*]美しいステンドグラスアート
[*]プレイに没頭できるNikita Sevalnevさんのサウンド
[*]構えずに一気にプレイし終えることができるボリュームとコスト[/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1][list]
[*]回転盤が操作しづらい
[*]たまにピースが関係ないところに埋まる[/list]

[h1]アートとサウンドが美しいのんびりとプレイできるジグソーパズル[/h1]

　Glass Masqueradeはアールデコ様式を基調とした置時計にステンドグラスのピースをはめていくジグソーパズル。フランスを出発点として、世界25か国それぞれの歴史や特徴を捉えた時計を完成させていきます。ステージの解放順は隣接した国がプレイアブルとなるため、プレイヤーによって自由に順序を変えることができます。

　良い点を挙げるならば、一目見てその色づかいと光沢感を推すことができます。画面全体から漂う上質感(ネスカフェの主張)が好きです。この姿勢が徹頭徹尾貫かれており、トレーラーのアートを見て気に入った人なら共感してもらえるのではないかと思います。またプレイしている最中にBGMがうるさく鳴ることもなく、控えめでしとやかなBGMがとても素敵です。作曲しているサウンドコンポーザーはロシアの方で[url=https://www.nikcomposer.com]Nikita Sevalnev[/url]さん。あ、ニキータとあるけど男性ですよ。

　パズルパートではバラバラとなったピースが周囲に置かれ、内円と外円の二重の回転盤をスライドさせることで当てはめたいピースを探すことになります。ただ、この回転盤が操作しづらく円環を移動させようとしてピースを掴むことが多く、誤操作が多く発生する印象です。幸いなことに置時計をモチーフとしていますが制限時間などは設けられていないため、ちょっとイラッとするだけで支障はありません。仮に制限時間などの要素があれば、また印象は異なっていたでしょう。

　ピースのサイズは時計の上での実際のサイズと異なり、微妙に拡大縮小されているので相似形を見つけることが大事です。そのため、あれやこれやとピースを盤上に持っていって試行錯誤することが多いのですが、時折持っていたピースが消えることがあります。消えた場所をクリックしたら再度現れるのですが、初見だと無くなって詰んだと思うかもしれないので注意が必要です。


　日本語ローカライズもされていますが、仮にされていなくてもプレイに全く問題ありません。また私はパズルゲームが苦手ですが、その私でも普通にクリアできました。時間さえあれば誰でもクリアできる難易度になっていると思います。ユーザビリティ的な見地から操作性に若干改善余地はあると思われますが、定価でもワンコインで買え、気負うことなく自分のペースでプレイできます。そこまで高いPCスペックも必要としないと思いますのでオススメです。全ステージをクリアするだけで全実績が解除されるため、実績大好きの人にもオススメですよ！

4.重玩價值幾乎無，除非你想挑戰自我看能拚多快XD

39106372.review:
[h1]当玻璃艺术与历史文化相互撞击产生别样的火花[/h1]
是冬促期间在steamcn上看到这款游戏更新了官中 只是多看了一眼就被精妙的玻璃拼图吸引 买下了这款折后七块的小游戏 截止写评测的此刻 共计二十五个国家的拼图已经完成了二十张

[h1] 表世界之一 色彩 [/h1]
瑰丽的色彩虽然变化多样但丝毫不显得杂乱 不是一味的色彩堆叠也基本都跳出了对事物传统的色彩定义 意想不到的配色引发的对比与碰撞反而让眼睛惊醒

[h1]表世界之二 声音 [/h1]
没有刻意留心 不过似乎不同大陆是不同风格的背景音乐 玻璃碎片散落于两个圆环之中 将其归位后会发出一声清脆的叮当 各国风情的图案缓缓完整 音乐贴合着画面 仿佛异域文化拉住了你的衣襟

[h1]里世界之一 艺术[/h1]
整个游戏建立在玻璃工艺之上 又或者说玻璃艺术更为妥帖 早年经常在图片或者视频中看到玻璃彩绘 总觉得好看是好看但算不上惊艳 直到自己前年留学德国期间 站在捷克圣维特大教堂内 阳光透过窗户上的玻璃彩绘洒下来 整个人不由得开始颤抖 在那一刻我相信世间确有天使

[h1]里世界之二 文化[/h1]
如前文所说 玻璃彩绘在西方常用于教堂的花窗 而在这款游戏内则是被用于钟表的表盘 不同国家的钟表有着不同的形状和不同的表盘图案 每个图案暗含着其国家文化的一角 不过仅是冰山一角 在每次完成拼图后我都会被惊艳 心里不由得感叹啊原来是这样

[h1]就如同凝固玻璃时会产生气泡[/h1]
这款游戏尚有不足 首先当然是很多玩家在评测中抱怨的游戏关卡过少 即使是新出dlc也好希望添加新的国家 其次是偶尔会出现碎片大小超过拼图空白部分 又或者拼接碎片之后发生出乎意料的错误 以上两种bug大概遇到五次左右 

[h1]有关拼贴玻璃拼图的技巧 [/h1]
每关初始都会给出几块暗红色带有圆环的提示碎片 将其与表盘上的圆环匹配就可以顺利完成一部分边框 接下来推荐首先找到框架 然后找寻独特边缘的碎片进行拼合 也可以先尝试拼接较大的碎片 因为表盘空间不大较大的碎片能放置的位置有限 最后完成表盘的中心部分和其他细小的碎片拼接

[h1]总评 8/10
只要七块钱 透过晶莹剔透的玻璃彩绘钟表 仿佛可以触摸到异域文化的一角
每轮拼图只需要几分钟到十几分钟 适合各类玩家空闲下来的时候放松心情 
这款游戏的成就是各国国旗很适合装饰展柜 同时徽章和背景也都非常好看 [/h1]

39055802.review:
A very nice little puzzle game, with really beautiful graphics (for a puzzle game of course) and a good, relaxing OST.

Each of the 25 puzzles are country-themed, making you "travelling" around the world through the stained-glass panels you have to put together. And these stained glass panels really are well-designed. As long as you've a fondness for this kind of things, the art-deco-style graphics tryly makes this game stand out among the plenty of puzzle games you can find of Steam.

The controls are simple and intuitive, with the pieces on two circles around the puzzle, easy to turn, even with when you use a pen tablet instead of a mouse. So you don't have to sort out anything, just to look at the pieces. Plus they are automatically rotated in their right position when you take them, which makes the game even easier.

Because yeah, there isn't any difficulty here. Of course, this is a puzzle game and not Darks Souls, but even so, none of the 25 panels have any particular tricky details that could made them longer than 10 minutes to complete. (In comparizon, I sometimes spent ~2 hours on some "Pixel Puzzles".)
So, obviously, the game is *very* short and can be fully completed in two, two hours and half at most.

However, it's still a very enjoyable game, beautiful, relaxing, with a unique feeling of his.

Maybe a little expensive for what it is at full price, but don't hesitate to grab it during sales.

39040817.review:
Glass Masquerade is a nice jigsaw puzzle game.

It reminded me of [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/444280/Alices_Patchwork/]Alice's Patchwork[/url]: the puzzles are really mosaics, which means the puzzle piece shapes correspond somewhat  to outlines of picture elements. You get a small number of pieces to work with (between 20 and 60), but there's additional difficulty, solving the problem of space. To really do a proper jigsaw on the computer, you'd need about three 4k monitors or you simply haven't got enough space to put all the parts. AP limited the amount of pices you could access; GM gives them to you on "scrollable" rings (which are really 4 bins), but it roattes them for you and blanks out the colors until you pick them up. At that point, the colors come back and the proper rotation is restored; the game would instantly become a lot harder if it wasn't. [i]Could you make that a game mode, dear developer?[/i] Also, having a frame helps a lot, even if you have "hint pieces" turned off.

The interface is well done and feels smooth, the game is fun to play. The only drawback is that it is short; with 25 puzzles taking 6 to 16 minutes, it's only a few hourse long (I needed 2 hours for 11 puzzles). I'm enjoying every minute of it.

[i]This game runs fullscreen or windowed.[/i]

39024186.review:
Glass Masquerade es un juego de armar vitrales que están desarmados como un rompecabezas.  

Lo bueno: el gameplay es sencillo, sin embargo, la forma en que las piezas están distribuidas y sin poder verlas hasta que las escoges, le da un nivel más alto de complejidad. Para un juego de armar rompecabezas, me pareció bastante pbueno como se maneja cada uno de los rompecabezas.
Los gráficos son hermosos. Cada vitral  armado es muy llamativo y en teoría alusivo al país que estás visitando (bueno, no tengo idea de porque en Argentina armé un vitral de los Incas). Al inicio del juego te dan la opción de visitar un par de países y de ahí se abren más opciones. 
El juego te indica el nivel de complejidad de ada rompecabezas por medio de un puntaje de 1 a 5. Los primeros son de 2 puntos, rápidamente pasas a 3 puntos, y en unos pocos minutos ya estarás al frente de los de 4 y 5 puntos. Por lo general, la dificultad si está bien representada. Un vitral de 2 o 3 puntos fácilmente se arma en unos 6 minutos, los de 4 puntos en 10 minutos o menos, y los de 5 puntos en unos 10 a 15 minutos.

Lo malo: Aunque la música es relajante y apta para el tipo de juego, es sumamente repetitiva.
Por otro lado, el juego cuenta con solo 25 rompecabezas. El numero puede parecer decente si ud es un jugador casual que no lo va a tomar muy seguido. Yo jugué un par de horas y creo que al solo 2 o 3 vitrales.
Y esto es lo que me hace no recomendar el juego solo si loconsigues en una muy buena oferta. El juego es sumamente corto, completar los 25 vitrales no tomará más de un par de horas, 4 horas si uno lo lleva con calma.
El juego pudo haber incluído una modalidad contra reljo o por puntaje que podría darle más contenido y reto al juego, pero así como está, aunque es muy reljante, es sumamente corto.

No es un mal juego, solo que debería incluir ya fuera más vitrales o diferentes modos de juego, para que así no se sintiera tan corto.

El juego no lo he finalizado aún, pero si al finalizar se expanden las opciones del juego, editaré esta reseña con nueva información.

38986360.review:
This is may be the single most beautiful game I've ever played. I'm partial to the stained glass style, but seriously, I'm in love with the game's aesthetics.

[h1]The good:[/h1]
+ Extremely high quality visuals. The subtle details and lighting changes are a joy to behold, and the animations are so smooth.
+ Also very high quality sound effects, and very fitting to the visuals. The music is subtle and pleasant, and always reflects the music of the current puzzle's country.
+ Straightforward gameplay

[h1]Mixed:[/h1]
~ Can be completed in 3 hours. Good for easy 100% achievements, bad because I feel I could play this game forever :)

[h1]The bad:[/h1]
- The controls are often finicky - you try to grab a piece, and you rotate the wheel. You try to rotate the wheel, and you grab a piece. The "areas of action" are strangely and invisibly overlapping, causing some annoyance.
- As I've seen with other similar games, the puzzle pieces are slightly larger "in the air" than when they are fitted into the picture, making it sometimes a bit difficult to see if a piece would fit a given space.

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]
If you like the stained glass style and the puzzle genre, I [b]strongly[/b] recommend this game :) I keep playing "just one more round" because interacting with this much artistic perfection puts me in such a blissful mood ^^

Los juegos de puzles casi siempre se quedan en un segundo plano o incluido como un minijuego para conseguir X recompensa. Son pocas las veces que descubrimos algún que otro título que sea exclusivamente el de armar piezas para conformar un bonito cuadro tipo vidriera.

No tiene una mecánica revolucionaría o una historia compleja, de hecho, carece de todo esto y solo tienes por objetivo reconstruir el vitral de 25 relojes que cada uno conforma un diseño único por cada país. Este juego sirve para desconectar del día a día ya que tanto su calmada y nada atrevida banda sonora junto a un arte preciosista, invita a prepararse un buen café y trabajar la memoria durante 2 o 3 horas que te puede durar completar todos los puzles.

Cada puzle tiene por nombre un país y el arte representativo es algo intrínseco en la propia cultura.
La dificultad del juego dependerá de tu paciencia y dedicación como jugador pero más que ver el título como un reto, se debería ver como lo que realmente es. Un homenaje al Art Déco y a los vitrales.

Nota: 6,5/10

39463868.review:
Yes, yes, yes. Yes! So much yes.

Stained glass... Ah, now there is something that will never not be beautiful. Onyx Lute absolutely nailed the artworks for Glass Masquerade. Truly! Each puzzle is particularly remarkable and represents a country, from my native Brazil up to Iceland; also, they have a jigsaw-like mechanic in order to be completed (with a suitable amount of challenge for it to entertain rather than frustrate). 

The soundtrack composed by Nikita Sevalnev is so soothing... It reminds me of cloudy and rainy days, magical forests full of benign creatures coming straight from fairytales. It sets the right mood for focusing and finishing the puzzle - I bet it also does wonders for reading, studying and even working.

The only flaw in this game is its length: too short. I want more. :3

P.S. I play in 21:9 and the resolution did not scale up to that of my monitor's. In fact, the letterboxes on both sides were not even black - they were white. Freakishly white and bloomy. So, note that down if you own an UW screen and intend on playing. I still recommend the game, though!
39463868.developer_response: Thanks for the feedback! - we've just fixed the issue with wide resolutions (including 21:9), which was actually caused by the last patch.
